definitions.definition: a series of connected metal rings, used for pulling or fastening things; a length of chain used for a particular purpose

examples.text: She wore a heavy gold chain around her neck.
The mayor wore his chain of office.
a bicycle chain
The prisoners were kept in chains *(= with chains around their arms and legs, to prevent them from escaping)*.
They kept the dog on a chain all day long.
a short length of chain
Let the dog off its chain.
The prisoner was led away in chains.
Put the chain on the door (= so the door can only be opened a little bit) before you go to bed.

definitions.definition: a series of connected things or people

examples.text: mountain/island chains
Volunteers formed a **human chain** *(= line of people)* to rescue precious items from the burning house.
to set in motion a **chain of events**
Our suppliers are the weakest **link in the chain**.
Volunteers formed a human chain to pass buckets of water to each other.
She was personally involved in this chain of events.
It's important to make sure the chain of communication is not broken.
If any part of the chain of infection is broken, the spread of the disease will be stopped.
the complex chain of events that led to the war
Middlemen are important links in the chain.
There has been an unbroken chain of great violinists in the family.
The people formed a human chain to pass the supplies up the beach.
a chain of volcanic islands

definitions.definition: a group of shops or hotels owned by the same company

examples.text: a **supermarket/hotel/retail chain**
a chain of stores/shops/restaurants
a chain of department stores
a chain of clothes shops
This hotel is part of a large chain.

definitions.definition: a thing that limits somebody’s freedom or ability to do something

examples.text: the chains of fear/misery

definitions.definition: a situation in which a number of people selling and buying houses must each complete the sale of their house before buying from the next person
a problem that prevents you from doing what you would like to do

examples.text: The responsibility was a ball and chain around my ankle.

definitions.definition: one of the stages in a process or a line of argument

examples.text: Food production, processing and marketing are different links in the chain from farmer to consumer.
Death is the last link in the chain.

definitions.definition: the point at which a system or an organization is most likely to fail

examples.text: She went straight for the one weak link in the chain of his argument.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French chaine, chaeine, from Latin catena ‘a chain’.
